name: Plank
steps: Start in a push-up position on the floor, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your toes on the ground.
Tighten your abdominal muscles and straighten your spine so that your body forms a straight line from your head to your heels.
Hold this position for as long as you can, ideally for 30 to 60 seconds.
Breathe deeply and evenly throughout the exercise.
To release the plank, lower your knees to the ground and rest in a child's pose or stand up slowly.
comments: Keep your elbows slightly bent and your forearms resting on the ground to reduce strain on your wrists.
Make sure your shoulders are directly above your elbows and your hips are level with your shoulders to maintain proper form.
Engage your glutes and quadriceps to keep your legs straight and your body stable.
Don't hold your breath! Remember to breathe steadily and deeply throughout the exercise.
Increase the duration or difficulty of the plank gradually over time.
